intro: Boehmeria racemiflora, commonly known as the Chinese nettle or mountain nettle, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in racemes, which are clustered along the stem. Boehmeria racemiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
